instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .
definitions.ADAPTER_SENSE: What is ADAPTER_SENSE? This is a line between the onewire circuit and the magsafe charger where the magsafe charger can talk to the SMC(system management controller) on the SYS_ONEWIRE line..
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.ALL_SYS: What is ALL_SYS? This is a typo of ALL_SYS_PWRGD When you see ALL_SYS, assume they meant to type ALL_SYS_PWRGD.
definitions.TPS51125: What is TPS51125? This is a power chip responsible for the PP3V3_S5,  PP5V_S5,  and PP5V_S3 power rails on many A1278 model Macbooks.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light but PPBUS and 3V42 present.
threads.message: This one has zero signs of liquid damage. PPBUS: 12.56 3V42: 3.42 volts. I checked both for shorts, but neither are shorted to ground. Tried known good DC in board and 85 watt no change. <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> has 18 volts on pins 1-3 and 4, so I assumed that might be the problem and replaced it. Still no change 18 volts on both gate and source. What do I check next? <RESISTOR>R7080</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7081</RESISTOR> measure correctly. This one I've been messing with for like 3 days so need help badly lol.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light but PPBUS and 3V42 present.
threads.message: Resistance to ground on pins 27 and 28 is 21.2 ohms pins 17 and 18 3.8 ohms on <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light but PPBUS and 3V42 present.
threads.message:
There should be no such resistance to GND and it would be impossible to have PPBUS, so I hope you measured between pins 27/28 17/18.

Simple green light issue....Known good magsafe board? ACOK present? Voltage on the adapter sense line?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light but PPBUS and 3V42 present.
threads.message: I do have 12.56 volts I could have measured wrong tho had many boards today. 3V42 is 3.42 volts, tried known good MagSafe does same thing as one with machine, ACOK is normal 3.3 and adapter sense is present.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light but PPBUS and 3V42 present.
threads.message: So <SIGNAL>ADAPTER_SENSE</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> are both 3.4V? If so then remove <CHIP>U6900</CHIP> and do a diode mode check on <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL>, SMC is now suspect.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light but PPBUS and 3V42 present.
threads.message: Ok will do when I get back to this one.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light but PPBUS and 3V42 present.
threads.message: Ok so yes adapter sense and sysonewire 3.4 volts. Removed <CHIP>U6900</CHIP> and in diode mode I get OL or 6.1 kilohms

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light but PPBUS and 3V42 present.
threads.message: *OL in ohms

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light but PPBUS and 3V42 present.
threads.message: Either a broken trace to the SMC or a dead SMC.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light but PPBUS and 3V42 present.
threads.message: Ewww wonderful lol. Will get back to this one once I get donors for it

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light but PPBUS and 3V42 present.
threads.message:
Ok resurrecting this one because finally got around to it. Replaced the SMC and now I have a power cycling issue.

PP3V42 stays at 3.48 volts and does not change
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> stays at 3.3 volts and does not change.

However,

PPBUS pulses between 12.52 and 12.58
VRTC pulses between 3.2 and 3.4 over and over again.
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> pulses between 3.3 it seems and 0
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> pulses between what seems to be 100 millivolts and 1.5 volts
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> pulses between 100 and 300 millivolts.

The only rail that is straight zero that I've checked is CPU VCore.

The green light intermittent as in it comes and goes out. Already replaced the clock chip.

Now that it power cycles, what could be causing it?

Current sensing circuit measures normal too in resistance mode.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light but PPBUS and 3V42 present.
threads.message: Checked all rails for shorts to GND? <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS</SIGNAL> pulsing too?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light but PPBUS and 3V42 present.
threads.message: Have not will check in the morning when I get back to it and will check ALL SYS

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light but PPBUS and 3V42 present.
threads.message: Ok so <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS</SIGNAL> stays pretty low. However, I think I have a short on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> resistance to ground is really low like 6 ohms to ground. I'll inject voltage and see what heats up. Is it safe to inject a lot of voltage into this line?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light but PPBUS and 3V42 present.
threads.message: Tried alcohol but can't find any heat. Going to get freeze spray it seems like injecting 5 volts at 1 amp nothing seems to get warm at all and the alcohol does bubble anywhere

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light but PPBUS and 3V42 present.
threads.message: And quick question, is there any chance the <CHIP>TPS51125</CHIP> could be causing this?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light but PPBUS and 3V42 present.
threads.message: If you inject 5V there is 1A flowing. That means you are putting 5W into the board and something must absolutely get warm. Use face/lips for heat detection and expect to get burned ;)

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light but PPBUS and 3V42 present.
threads.message: Haha ok I'm gonna try again Monday I wanna fix this first time finally getting a SMC correct and it was so awful lol

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light but PPBUS and 3V42 present.
threads.message: Found it! Put 5 volts and 3 amps through it and either <CAPACITOR>C6214</CAPACITOR> or <CAPACITOR>C6213</CAPACITOR> were shorted so pulled both and short is gone! Got to put a lot back, but I will test once everything is back on the board.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light but PPBUS and 3V42 present.
threads.message: FAN FUCKING SPIN BABY. Now going to test and see if it chimes and all that and run ASD. Light goes from green to orange with battery plugged in tho :)

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light but PPBUS and 3V42 present.
threads.message: It worked!!!! Passed ASD and all thank you Duke for all the help this one was definitely a challenge!!!
